item.title: Transnational Criminal Organization Illicit Spotter Prevention and Elimination Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Border Security.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text:
Transnational Criminal Organization Illicit Spotter Prevention and Elimination Act

Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to make it a crime to: (1) transmit to another person the location, movement, or activities of law enforcement agents while intending to further a federal crime relating to U.S. immigration; and (2) destroy, alter, or damage any physical or electronic device used by the federal government to control the border or any port of entry.

Subjects a violator to fine, up to 10 years' imprisonment, or both.

Prohibits the carrying or use of a firearm in an alien smuggling crime.

bill.title: Transnational Criminal Organization Illicit Spotter Prevention and Elimination Act

item.title: Transnational Criminal Organization Illicit Spotter Prevention and Elimination Act
A bill to prohibit the intentional hindering of immigration, border, and customs controls, and for other purposes.
Transnational Criminal Organization Illicit Spotter Prevention and Elimination Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
